Case reference: 2013000038.CaseDesc: Samuel Lachance was last seen at the Beverage Room in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan near the end of July, 1987. Samuel was in very good physical condition at the time of his disappearance and worked in different logging camps in Saskatchewan. Family members say that it was unusual for Samuel not to have any contact with them or his friends near the time he was last seen.

Case reference: 2006004599.CaseDesc: Igor Tikhomirov jumped or fell off an oil tanker into Lake Ontario en route from Holland to Sarnia on May 12, 1996.  His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2010005899.CaseDesc: Mark Edmonson disappeared from his residence in Stoney Creek on October 3, 1999. Mr. Edmonson has not returned or contacted his family members since that time and both his family and Police are concerned for his well being. Mr. Edmonson is developmentally challenged. It is believed that Mr. Edmonson left home without taking any money or personal identification. Extensive police searches have failed to determine his whereabouts.

Pants: Blue, Jeans with hole in left knee

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2014005083.CaseDesc: Alexander Belcourt was reported missing by his family in November 1995. He has not been seen or heard from since September 1991. During the time of his disappearance, Alexander was known to live in the inner core of Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2014006627.CaseDesc: On November 9, 2012, Andria Meise was reported missing from Kelowna, British Columbia. Andria was last seen in Grande Prairie, Alberta between July 2010 and September 2010. Andria was known to be living a high risk lifestyle and traveled between Grande Prairie, Dawson Creek, Fort St. John, Kelowna and Vancouver.

Case reference: 2014003163.CaseDesc: John Timothy McCarthy was last seen in Red Deer, Alberta on May 1, 1991. His van was located in Sault St Marie, Ontario, however it is not known if he stayed in the Ontario region or went on to the United States.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold, Wedding ring with small diamonds

Case reference: 2014005921.CaseDesc: On June 19, 2012, at approximately noon, Diane Bonneau was seen for the last time at her residence in Saint-Félicien, Quebec. Diane hasn’t been seen and we haven’t heard from her since.

Case reference: 2013000092.CaseDesc: Jacques Boulanger was last seen on September 1, 1989 from Montreal. Jacques loved sleeping outside even though he had a home.

Case reference: 2014002009.CaseDesc: Leroy Marshall, AKA Roy Marshall, has been missing since July 23, 1979. Mr. Marshall moved in with his sister on the west side of Saint John in June of 1979. He had a job interview with the School District on July 23, 1979 but failed to show. Mr. Marshall lived in Somerville, Massachusetts, US, between 1961 and 1971.

Case reference: 2014003946.CaseDesc: Jean Siegel went missing from her home on May 31, 1962. Ms. Siegel had left her home on three previous occasions but always returned on her own. Jean Siegel's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2018029523.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017, Helen Okolo was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016068405.CaseDesc: On March 29, 1970, the remains of a male were found on the Lake Erie shore in Point Pelee National Park. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated that he had been in the water for approximately 1 week to 6 months prior to discovery.

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2018040311.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2003, Karanjeet Singh was seen for the last time as he left with some of his personal belongings to go visit a friend in Toronto, Ontario. Karanjeet was visiting Toronto from India and was due to return on May 24.

Case reference: 2022017854.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2022, Laura Huebner was last seen at the Victoria International airport in Sidney, British Columbia.  Sometime later that same day, she had travelled to Nanaimo. Laura has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Long sandy blonde hair

Case reference: 2014001632.CaseDesc: Elizabeth Dorion was last seen by a friend at a local fishing camp on September 21, 1999. Ms. Dorion arrived at the fishing camp on the 17th of September with her friends and stayed there approximately 4 days. She was never seen again. Two separate ground searches were carried out. Several steep embankments as well as the area surrounding the camp were searched with negative results. Ms. Dorion's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2010003999.CaseDesc: During the evening of Friday May 28, 1999, Tammy Lamondin, age 20,  was with friends on Main Street in Newmarket. She remained in their company until sometime after midnight. In the early morning hours of May 29, 1999, Tammy left the Newmarket area with a male acquaintance. She was not seen again. The police conducted an investigation but were not able to locate her.

Tattoo: Right Ankle, Dolphin above right ankle

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014004860.CaseDesc: Lesley Holmes was reported missing by her common law husband on December 23, 2005 after not having contact with her since November 23, 2005.  They had been living in a basement apartment in Toronto, the home of a friend. Lesley did not feel comfortable staying there without her common law who was away, so she moved out. She was believed to have spent some time in a shelter but this could not be confirmed by the shelter.  Her family has not seen or heard from her since that time.

Case reference: 2014003981.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1978, Wayne Kevin Spark was last seen in Richmond, British Columbia. Wayne left home to attend Vancouver Community College but never showed up. Wayne has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003631.CaseDesc: Xiu Zi Lin was last seen on February 3, 1998 in Montreal. Ms. Lin came from China with no documentation or family. She was placed in a shelter. She left the center without giving a new address.

Case reference: 2017021464.CaseDesc: Since April 14, 2017, Deborah Anne Hutchinson's family has not seen or heard from her. Deborah's vehicle was later located in the Cossitt Heights area.

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2020010931.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1987, at approximately 10:20am, Farad Khan was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Farad had left his home following an argument with his wife.

Case reference: 2018053566.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1995, at approximately 8:30am, Robert Walmsley was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Robert was scheduled to meet with his sister the following day, but did not show up.

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2016043636.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1976, the body of a woman was discovered in a backyard in the Parkdale area of Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020147.CaseDesc: On March 25, 1996, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Upper Levels Highway in West Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had recovered from severe injuries to his right arm and leg. He also had a fractured skull, nose and ribs. These injuries were likely a result of a single major accident. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Corduroy, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 3/4 length coat with fleece
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Side Of Head, Recent fracture to the left temporal bone above the left ear
Nose, Old nasal fracture with visible deformity
Deformity: Shoulders, Old injury; no indication of which shoulder

Case reference: 2014003046.CaseDesc: Yu Lowe was last seen on February 15, 1984 when he left his home in Vancouver, British Columbia. Mr. Lowe said he was going to the movies and never came back.

Case reference: 2016064705.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, a partial skull was found on the bank of the North Saskatchewan River, north of Derwent, Alberta. The individual had likely been deceased for more than 5 years

Case reference: 2018041254.CaseDesc: On July 10, 2018, Ashley Morin was last seen leaving a house, on foot, in North Battleford, Saskatchewan

Case reference: 2018009360.CaseDesc: On February 18, 1987, George Christie was last seen at the intersection of Broadview Avenue and Queen Street East in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020080.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2004, at 11:30 p.m., Courtney Struble, 13 years old, was last seen walking towards her residence in Estevan, SK. There have been reported sightings of Courtney, however, despite investigations and searches, she has not been located.

Mark: Neck, birthmark at nape of neck

Case reference: 2014005363.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1986, Edward Beauchamp failed to meet with his probation officer for a scheduled appointment in Edmonton, Alberta. Edward has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, "Born To Be Wild"
Left Forearm, "Born to Raise Hell 1952 Eddie"
Right Hand, "Love" on backs of fingers
Left Hand, Club, diamond, spade and heart on knuckles
Left Hand, "Hate" on backs of fingers
Right Forearm, Cobra and tumbleweed chief
Right Upper Arm, "Born to be free"

Case reference: 2014003615.CaseDesc: On September 26th, 1970, Mr. Claus and his friend were reported missing to police as they were overdue by boat. A pilot later spotted a swamped boat on Cormorant Lake, Manitoba and advised police. Despite patrols and dragging operations Mr. Claus was never located. His partner was later found and the cause of death determined to be drowning. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2009000299.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1989 at approximately 5:30 pm, Mr. George Giles and a friend left Mr. Giles' cottage on Fox Island in Lake Simcoe enroute to a marina at Island Grove.  Weather conditions were very poor at the time and the boat eventually capsized some distance from shore, after taking on water. His friend managed to swim back to Fox Island but Mr. Giles was not able to make it to shore, due to the treacherous weather and water conditions. On November 20th, 1989 the boat was discovered stranded on a sandbank near Joyland Beach in Orillia. Mr. Giles' body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2017055687.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2017, Ryan Mead was seen for the last time leaving his family residence in Brampton, Ontario to travel to British Columbia. Mr. Mead purchased camping equipment in Medicine Hat, Alberta in May of 2017. Some of his possessions were recovered along the South Saskatchewan River in late May.

Case reference: 2020007826.CaseDesc: Gerhart Kiel was reported missing from his residence in Minburn, Alberta. His vehicle, a dark grey 2009 Ford Ranger which has a truck bed cover in the same colour, was also reported missing from his residence. Gerhart has not had any contact with his family since November 23, 2019.

Case reference: 2014002608.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1998, Jong Donohue was seen for the last time as he departed from Camrose, Alberta. It is possible that Jong may have had plans to travel to Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014003102.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1972, David Kyak was seen for the last time in Iqaluit, Nunavut.

Hat: Canvas, Blue, Ball cap, Polar bear crest

Case reference: 2014004183.CaseDesc: Virginia Sampare was last seen on October 14, 1971. Ms. Sampare was despondent over the death of her boyfriend. Ms. Sampare left the residence in the evening of that date and was not seen again.

Shirt: Cotton, Short sleeve navy blue shirt

Case reference: 2014003919.CaseDesc: On September 19, 2000, Ronald Montgomery went missing from his home in Calgary. He has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2020008535.CaseDesc: On March 6, 1991, at approximately 1:00pm, Martin Stocker was last seen at his retirement home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020138.CaseDesc: The 18 month old Yohanna went missing after the mother entrusted the custody of her daughter to her boyfriend while she was out of town for a few days. They all lived in the Saint Laurent area in Montreal. Upon her return to Montreal, the mother was told that her baby was in Washington with the boyfriend’s mother. She went to the United States to find her daughter, but could not locate her. Returning to Quebec, the mother alerted the police of her child’s disappearance. The boyfriend claimed then that the child drowned in the bathtub during the mother’s absence and that she had been buried before the mother’s return. He was questioned and then released due to lack of evidence.

Case reference: 2018063232.CaseDesc: On December 31, 1999, Elizabeth Shelly was last seen as she left the shelter she was staying at in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004614.CaseDesc: Jacob Miller has gone missing in the past, however he has always returned. Mr. Miller was last seen in Winnipeg, MB going for a walk carrying a green backpack and appearing quite disheveled.

Case reference: 2014002167.CaseDesc: On July 7th, 1973, Mr. Gorrie and his family were seen returning from a day of fishing on Cross Lake by the local RCMP patrol. Mr. Gorrie followed the patrol boat for some time and eventually the family boarded the patrol boat while Mr. Gorrie continued to follow in his boat. Both vessels proceeded west however after a time, the height of the waves increased (7 to 8 ft.). As a result the patrol boat had to increase power, which substantially increased the distance between the respective boats. Mr. Gorrie's boat was last seen a 1/2 mile behind the patrol. Immediate searches by air provided negative results. It is presumed that Mr. Gorrie drowned as he or the boat have never been located.

Case reference: 2014001578.CaseDesc: Benjamin ARSENAULT went missing from 172 Sydney St, Saint John, NB (Rooming House). He was wearing a grey suit coat.

Case reference: 2014004990.CaseDesc: On January 6, 1978, at approximately 11:00 p.m., John McNichol was seen for the last time as he left the Crock & Block restaurant located in downtown Kitchener, Ontario. John had met with a friend that evening, and the two had planned to see each other again the next day. The following morning, he failed to show up for work and a note was found stating that he had to leave.

Luggage: SUITCASE, Suitcase, contained Leonard Cohen records
Shirt: Orange, « Grandma Lee » checkered, short sleeve

Case reference: 2022009281.CaseDesc: Heather Stoodley and her father moved out of their Burlington, Ontario home in October 2021 to live off-grid due to religious obligations. In the course of this process, they ceased utilizing social media and all other known technologies and cancelled their bank accounts. Her mother, who was worried that her daughter wouldn't be able to leave if she had a change of heart, reported her missing in March 2022. Heather’s whereabouts or ability to be reached has not been established.

Case reference: 2014003138.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1981, John Sanderson was with some friends in Berens River, Manitoba.  He left in a 22' boat heading for Jackhead, Manitoba.  Friends tried to stop him from leaving due to the high winds but he left anyway. On October 19, 1981, the boat that he had taken was found upside down and partly submerged near the shore of Pigeon Point. Gas cans that had been in the boat were also located.  Searches were done by air and water but the body of John was never found. It is presumed that Mr. Sanderson drowned.

Case reference: 2006010099.CaseDesc: David Stevens was last seen June 14, 1979, in a canoe on the Ogoki River, approximately 70 km north of Armstrong. He was believed to be going towards Whitewater Lake. An extensive search failed to locate Mr. Stevens.

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2020004223.CaseDesc: On December 24, 2019, Ryan Docherty was seen for the last time by his family in London, Ontario. The last known contact between Ryan and his friends was during the last week of December. On March 6, 2020, his mother reported him missing after returning from an extended trip, and noticing that Ryan had not shown up at her residence to retrieve some cheques.

Scar: Right Hand, 3 inches on the top
Tattoo: Upper Back, Words: "EAZY-E"; gun and bullet
Left Hand, A heart with the name "Jodi"
Left Wrist, 6 eyes inside a triangle
Chest, Doc and Pennywise the clown

Case reference: 2022016834.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2022, Shawn Mines was seen for the last time doing renovations in a residence in Portage La Praire, Manitoba. A week prior to his disappearance, Shawn’s mother passed away, and he was despondent.

Case reference: 2012020079.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1991, Lavina Tocher was last seen in Parkman, Saskatchewan. On the 12th of December of that year, she was reported missing. Investigation and searches have failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2005001099.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2004, an unidentified woman was discovered in a red 2004 Toyota Corolla under the Highway 400 Bridge on Highway 401 in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts this female to be from the Americas, South Asia, or Mixed Americas.

Case reference: 2013000128.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1990, Delphine Nikal was left in the care of her uncle. At approximately 2:00 pm Delphine advised her uncle she was going to meet her three girlfriends in Smithers BC (approx 16 km. away).  Delphine hitchhiked to Smithers and met up with her friends. At approximately 10:00 pm Delphine called her uncle to tell him that she was on her way home from Smithers. She was last seen by her two friends hitchhiking in the east bound lane of Hwy #16.

Jacket: Denim, Blue, Light bleached with white pocket sewn on inside, Levi's
Pants: Denim, Pink, Described as a hot pink and tight to the leg. Knee length
Purse: Leather, Black, Pouch style containing hair spray, brush, pictures, make up, address book

Case reference: 2014002267.CaseDesc: On April 11, 1992, Pawel Gazdzicki was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Pawel was despondent, suffered from mental health issues, and may have lost his memory. He had mentioned wanting to jump off of the Champlain Bridge.

Case reference: 2016061231.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1968, an unidentified male was found hanging in a hotel room. He had checked in under the name Henry Drendorf. No identification was found. This individual was found with several bags of architectural books.

Case reference: 2009004799.CaseDesc: Neil McDougall left Three-Way Demolition in Durham on Friday, October 11, 1985 with a co-worker and went home. He had an argument with his wife and the friend left. After supper Mr. McDougall went to Ayton, to the Commercial Hotel. He left the hotel with someone else and they met up elsewhere with the co-worker.  Mr. McDougall returned to the hotel and left at closing time, between 1:30 – 1:40 am. He was last reported leaving a residence on Edmund Street, Ayton at 2 a.m. October 12, 1985. His pickup truck was discovered near Ayton later that day. The ashtray was filled with different brands of cigarette butts. He has been described as meticulous, habitual, responsible and hardworking. When he went missing, Neil was planning to adopt his wife's children. Foul play is suspected. Mr. McDougall was declared legally dead in 1996.

Jacket: Blue, Work style with name on it

Case reference: 2022015231.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2022, Kyle Brocklebank was seen for the last time walking in the area of Thirty Road, in the town of Smithville, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020007628.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1971, at approximately 8:30pm, Stephanie Rawlinson was last seen near 2801 Jane Street in Toronto, Ontario. Stephanie had left her home in a cab after getting into a disagreement.

Mark: Right Eye, Mole near right eye

Case reference: 2012020013.CaseDesc: Angeline Pete was last seen on May 26, 2011 leaving her residence in North Vancouver, BC.  Miss Pete's disappearance is suspicious and foul play cannot be excluded.

Hair: Brown, Long, Dyed, Often dyes it

Case reference: 2022036931.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2022, Keith Zajac was seen for the last time in Brandon, Manitoba. During the time of his disappearance, Keith was traveling from Squamish, British Columbia to Ontario. That same day, his vehicle was located near Highway 1, approximately 10 kilometers west of Brandon. Several witnesses reported seeing Keith walking along the highway, westbound on the Assiniboine River's edge.

Hair: Blonde, Other, Hair shaved to one quarter; blonde, greying
Teeth: Left upper inciser broken and looks smaller

Case reference: 2014004294.CaseDesc: On May 28, 2001, Jean-Paul Leroux was seen for the last time when he left his spouse’s residence in Montreal, Quebec.  His vehicle was located abandoned 7 days later in the parking lot of the Saint-Leonard shopping centre. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2008245047.CaseDesc: Jadon may be in the company of his non-custodial mother Roxana Eliana YANEZ PARADA.

Case reference: 2014006326.CaseDesc: Ronald Kay was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on November 26, 2013. He was last seen at the Saskatchewan Rough Riders Football game and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003667.CaseDesc: On May 23, 1996, at approximately 7:30 p.m., Kevin Lotysz was seen for the last time as he left the McKellar Hospital in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Kevin is an avid drummer and enjoys music.

Mark: Cheek, Birthmark on lower right cheek
Tattoo: Chest, Sword on left side of chest

Case reference: 2013000046.CaseDesc: On June 27, 2004, Richard McGuire was seen for the last time in the Nouveau-Rosemont district of Montreal, Quebec. His vehicle was found in a garage located in the municipality of St-Elzear in the La Nouvelle-Beauce Regional County in Quebec.

Case reference: 2014001782.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1972, Kenneth Kay was seen for the last time as he attended the First Nation Treaty days in Quinton, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014003956.CaseDesc: Mary Louise Lejeune was last seen on February 23, 1991 in Montreal, Quebec. She left without notifying her family and she has not been heard from since.

Coat: Wool, Grey, Purple collar and wrists

Case reference: 2001008160.CaseDesc: Jesokah was last seen at approximately 21:30 hours as she was going to take a bus back to the village of Sooke.

Case reference: 2014003380.CaseDesc: On May 9th, 1961, Brenda Byman was last seen on a hike with some classmates in the area of Wilmer, British Columbia, when she allegedly walked off into the bush and did not return. Brenda has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Blue, Parka, With pink hood

Case reference: 2011005499.CaseDesc: Lukas was last seen on October 3, 2011, heading into the bushes behind Chomista Trailer park. His duffle bag was located in the bushes with his personal property on October 7, 2011. He was en route to his sister's place, but never arrived. Lukas has ties to Winnipeg and Calgary.

Case reference: 2023014476.CaseDesc: Paul Hahn left his Amherst, New York home on April 21st, 2022 to go kayaking on Lake Ontario near Golden State Hill Park, New York, USA. At the time of his disappearance, he was in possession of an orange and black Old Towne Sportsman motorized 120 kayak. His vehicle was located unoccupied in the state park however Paul has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005495.CaseDesc: David Harrison Powell went missing on September 22, 2010. Mr. Powell was last seen leaving his residence. His vehicle and other important property were left behind.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Ankle, Unhealed break, Walks with a limp

Case reference: 2014005841.CaseDesc: Alfred Sassin has not been seen since he left his home in downtown Vancouver on July 9, 2012. Mr. Sassin's absence was reported to police by the resident caretakers on July 16, as they had not seen him for over a week, which was unusual for him.

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2014004918.CaseDesc: On September 15th, 1993, three men were en route to Wuskwatim Lake via the Burntwood River intending to engage in commercial fishing. The men departed Nelson House, according to the only survivor they hit a rock and the motor quit. The boat was not equipped with a starter and the men were unable to restart the boat prior to going through the rapids.   Despite an intensive land, water and air search the bodies of Mr. Moose and Mr. Spence were never recovered.

Case reference: 2021022793.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2021, Thomas Grise was seen for the last time at a family members residence in Sturgeon Lake Cree Nation, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020142.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2008, Shannon Alexander, 17 and Maisy Odjick, 16, were reported missing from the First Nation community of Kitigan Zibi in Quebec. This community is located near the town of Maniwaki. On September 5, 2008, the two girls went to the Maniwaki arena, where several young people were present. Maisy then went to spend the night at Shannon’s house. Shannon’s father was the last person to have seen his daughter on September 6, 2008. In 2015 an age progression was done for both Maisy and Shannon.

Pierce: Mouth, 2 loops on the lower lip

Case reference: 2019049183.CaseDesc: On March 4, 2017, an unidentified woman was found in a state of acute confusion on East Cordova Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was taken to hospital, but died due to advanced and untreated breast cancer. She gave the name of Elizabeth MacKay to health services, but had no identification with her and her name could not be confirmed.

Case reference: 2014002978.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1982, a witness saw Louisette ST-ARNEAULT fall from the Laviolette Bridge in Trois-Rivières. Her body was never recovered.

Case reference: 2014005597.CaseDesc: On October 1, 2010, André Benoit was last seen at his home in Sainte-Marguerite-du-Lac-Masson. André may have gone to Montreal in the days preceding his disappearance. The attempts to locate Mr. Benoit have been negative to this date.

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2020010776.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1968, Samuel Hall was seen for the last time when he went out onto Lake Ontario for a fishing trip. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Blue, Grey, Work, Emblem with the letters "BA"

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018063868.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2018, Apu Akbar was last seen by his roommates at his home in St. John’s, Newfoundland. Mr. Akbar’s grey Honda Civic was located on November 8, 2018, in the area of Kavanagh’s Lane and Windgap Road in Flatrock, Newfoundland. The keys were still in the ignition and his cellphone was found in the vehicle. Apu is originally from Bangladesh.

Case reference: 2012020126.CaseDesc: Rollande Doherty, 52 years old, disappeared on February 2nd 2007. She was last seen around 2:30pm near the library in Rouyn-Noranda.

Case reference: 2014005526.CaseDesc: Angela Meyer went missing from her parents’ residence. She was on a weekend pass from Stanton Territorial Hospital and under the legal guardianship of her mother. Miss Meyer had gone outside of the residence for a cigarette and has not been seen since. There were sightings of her walking in the Con Mine area.  She was taking various medications and did not take the medications with her when she went missing.

Jacket: Nylon, Red, Black, Hip length, black on the back of sleeves

Case reference: 2006007399.CaseDesc: On January 5, 1991 Bruce Blimkie left the Riverview Inn in Norway Bay, Quebec, to travel home by snowmobile, across the Ottawa River, to Arnprior, Ontario.  It is believed that Mr. Blimkie was travelling in an area of the Ottawa River where there was open water, and that his snowmobile went through the ice into the water. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014004730.CaseDesc: Geoffry MacGibbon was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. In 1978, Geoffrey and his family moved to Toronto, Ontario from Quebec. He is schizophrenic and has been in several mental institutions in Canada and the United States of America.

Scar: Front Of Neck, Tracheostomy scar on throat
